definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: He always inoculates me with new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 我給孩子們灌輸禮貌的思想。

sentences.english: However, it's more polite than a direct request.
sentences.chinese: 但是，比起直接的詢問，這是一種更爲禮貌的請求。

sentences.english: We'll discuss more about how to make software more polite and considerate in Chapter 12.
sentences.chinese: 我們會在第12章討論如何讓軟件更有禮貌和體貼人。

sentences.english: Secondly, it should be polite, helpful.
sentences.chinese: 其次，應該禮貌待人，熱心助人。

sentences.english: It is rude to cut your bread or bite from it.
sentences.chinese: 用刀切或直接咬都是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: It is polite and proper to lift small bowls of rice or soup when you eat.
sentences.chinese: 當你喫小碗米飯或湯時，把它端起來是禮貌和適當的。

sentences.english: Thank you notes are not only about good  etiquette but self-marketing, too.
sentences.chinese: 感謝字條不僅僅是一種禮貌也是一種自我營銷。

sentences.english: It is bad manners to be absent-minded when other people talk to you.
sentences.chinese: 別人同你講話時出心不在焉是沒禮貌的。

sentences.english: I don't like your pert way of speaking.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜歡你那說話沒禮貌的樣子。

sentences.english: It is impolite to butt into other people's conversation.
sentences.chinese: 別人談話時插嘴是不禮貌的。

sentences.english: Now you can have your own miniature version courtesy of Mathmos.
sentences.chinese: 現在您可以讓您的Mathmos自己的縮影禮貌。

sentences.english: It is also impolite to have your elbows on the dining table when you are eating.
sentences.chinese: 而且在用餐時把手肘放在餐桌上是不禮貌的行爲。

sentences.english: Friendship cannot live with ceremony, nor without civility.
sentences.chinese: 友情不能無主套，但也長不了禮貌。

sentences.english: It is impolite to burp at the table.
sentences.chinese: 在餐桌上打嗝是很不禮貌的。

sentences.english: Keqi (kuh chi) refers to a sort of system of being polite.
sentences.chinese: 可以使一種講禮貌的系統。

sentences.english: Politeness militated against this opinion being expressed.
sentences.chinese: 禮貌對錶達的意見有影響。
